content.title: AVF Types
content.definition: Common AVF configurations: radiocephalic, brachiocephalic, brachiobasilic transposition. More distal preferred.
content.statement: AVF Types is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Dialysis-Access that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding AVF Types helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of AVF Types include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of AVF Types.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
